div.l: That she hadde lyrned in the nonnrye
A doughter hadde they be twix hem twoo
Of twenty yere age with outen moo
Savyng a childe that was of half a yere of age
In Cradill he lay and was a proper page
This wenche thick and wele groen was
With Camouse nose and Eyen gray as glas
And buttokes brode and brestes rounde and hye
But right faire was here heere I wil not lye
The persone of the towne for she was fayre
In purpose was to make hir his ayre
Bothe of his catelle and of his mesuage
And straunge made it of hir mariage
His purpos was to be stowe hir hye
Into some worthy blode of auncetrye
For hooly chirche good moste be dispended
On hooly chirche blode that is dissended
Therfore he wolde his Iolye blode honoure
Though that he shulde hooly chirche devoure
Grete soken hadde this myln̉er saunce doute
With whete and malte of all the lande a boute
And namely there was a grete colage
Men clepe it the Solere all of Cambrygge
There was her whete and eke theire malte grounde
And on a day it happed in a stounde
Seke laye the maunsiple on a maledye
Men wende wissly that he shulde deye
For which this Myln̉er stale bothe mele and corne
A thousand parte more than he did be forne
For there be forne he stale but Curteslye
But nowe he is a thefe outrageouslye
For which the wardeyne chidde and made fare
But therof the myln̉er sette not a tare
He craked boste and swore it was not soo
Then were there pore scolers twoo
That dwelled in the halle which I seye
Testyf they were and lusty for to pleye
And oonly for her myrthe and reverye
Vppon the wardeyn faste gan they crye
To yeve hem leve but a litell stounde
For to go to the mylne and se her corne grounde
And hardely they durste ley her necke
The myln̉er shulde not stele hem half a pecke
